org.eng.aisp.feature.io

Class CSVFeatureWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.aisp.feature.io.AbstractFeatureWriter
      • org.eng.aisp.feature.io.CSVFeatureWriter

  • public class CSVFeatureWriter
extends AbstractFeatureWriter
    Extend the super class to write each labeled feature as a set of comma-separated values. See #write(Writer, int, int, ILabeledFeature) for details on the format.
    Author:
    dawood

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(Writer writer,
                  int windowIndex,
                  int subwindowIndex,
                  IFeature<double[]> feature,
                  Properties labels)
           throws IOException
        Write the feature in a CSV format. Columns are defined as follows:
        1. 0-based window index,
        2. 0-based subwindow index,
        3. text specification of the layout of the feature data in the form P[xQ[xR...]. When more than 1 dimension is present, data is flattend in row-major order (C-style). So for a 2x3 tensor [[0, 1, 2], [3, 4, 5]] becomes [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5].
        4. List of semi-colon separated labels in name=value format,
        5. and following columns contain the list of features values for a given subwindow of data.
        No headers are written. For example, 
         0,0,2x128,gender=male;type=snore_nose;event=cough;smoker=false,-0.6391045345918763,-0.6232059399708378,...
        The first two integers are the window index and the subwindow index.
        Specified by:
        write in class AbstractFeatureWriter
        windowIndex - 0-based index of window given to AbstractFeatureWriter.write(Writer, Iterable) from which the feature was extracted.
        subwindowIndex - 0-based index of the sub-window within a data window from which the given feature was extracted.
        feature - feature extracted from the Nth sub-window of the Mth data window.
        labels - labels for those features.
        Throws:
        IOException
